title: PRD ReDesign: BMI Calculator For Weight Loss Category

background.description: The BMI Calculator is designed to serve as an interactive and SEO-friendly element on the Weight Loss category page.
background.purpose: It provides users with a fast, private, and informative way to assess whether their weight falls within a healthy range, giving them immediate context and helping connect their self-awareness with potential medical treatment options offered by DoktorABC.

goals.for_doktorabc: Strengthens engagement and drives conversions toward consultations and paid orders

formats: As a popup message opening from the bottom of the screen when the user clicks 'Calculate my BMI.'
As a static section embedded within the Weight Loss category drilldown

characteristics: Often struggling with overweight or obesity, concerned about appearance and health
Unsure if they need medication or whether it's safe for them
Seek private, quick validation, 'Where do I stand?'
Motivation: clarity, safety, cost, and eligibility for treatment

persona.mindset: 'I'm worried about my weight but not sure what to do next. I want a simple, trustworthy way to check if I need help, without talking to anyone yet.'

success_metrics: Improved SEO performance and ranking in the 'Weight Loss' category (through the BMI content section)
Conversion rate from users who used the calculator → paid orders (tracked across full funnel)
Higher engagement (CTR on 'Calculate my BMI' and 'Start Consultation' CTAs)

requirements: Widget appears in the Weight Loss category drilldown section on the homepage
Button labeled 'Calculate my BMI' triggers popup from the bottom up
Subtitle: 'BMI stands for Body Mass Index. It's a simple calculation that uses your height and weight to estimate whether your weight is within a healthy range for your body.'
Circular 'BMI Clock' showing four ranges from low to high
Center text shows current BMI value (default = 0, updated after calculation)
Legend below the dial: Underweight: < 18.5, Healthy weight: 18.5-24.9, Overweight: 25-29.9, Obesity: > 30
After clicking Calculate, the user's BMI range is highlighted visually on the clock and legend

If user's BMI is Overweight or Obese, display: Message: 'Find out if our weight loss treatments are right for you.', Images: Ozempic medication + another weight loss product, CTA Button: 'Start Consultation' (below images)
Same layout and functionality but displayed inline on the category page
Below the calculator, include SEO-optimized informational content pulled from BMI Google Doc
Arrange content visually for readability (subheadings, numbered lists, light background, consistent spacing)

development_requirements.description: The BMI Calculator widget appears inside the Weight Loss drilldown section on the homepage. The widget is triggered via a button labeled 'Calculate my BMI'.
When the user clicks 'Calculate my BMI', open the BMI Calculator as a bottom-up popup (bottom sheet). The pop-up must cover most of the screen and include a close X icon.

The popup contains: Title: 'BMI Calculator', Subtitle: 'BMI stands for Body Mass Index. It's a simple calculation that uses your height and weight to estimate whether your weight is within a healthy range for your body.'

Display two input fields, each with a label above them: Height (cm) – numeric input, Weight (kg) – numeric input. Validation rules: Both fields required, Must be positive numbers, Error state: red outline and small error text below field.
Button labeled 'Calculate' appears below the inputs. When clicked: Validate the input fields, Calculate BMI using formula: BMI = weight (kg) / (height (m)²), Scroll the popup to show results section.
Below the Calculate button display a secondary button labeled 'Start Consultation'. Clicking it leads to the Weight Loss consultation funnel.

After calculation, show the BMI result section, which includes: Circular BMI 'clock' dial with 4 ranges: Underweight, Healthy weight, Overweight, Obesity. The dial must visually highlight the user's range (color change). Center text shows the BMI number (e.g., 24.8). Default (before calculation): BMI = 0 and all ranges neutral.
Below the dial display the static legend: Underweight: < 18.5, Healthy weight: 18.5-24.9, Overweight: 25-29.9, Obesity: > 30. The legend value corresponding to the user's BMI must be highlighted.

If user's BMI falls into Overweight or Obesity, show a recommendation card: Image: Ozempic + Weight Loss product, Message: 'Find out if our weight loss treatments are right for you.', CTA button: 'Start Consultation'. This block appears directly below the BMI result section.

Under the calculator results, display SEO-optimized BMI educational content pulled from the provided BMI Google Doc. Formatting requirements: Use subheadings (e.g., 'What is BMI?', 'How to calculate BMI'), Use bulleted or numbered lists where appropriate, Light background, soft padding, consistent spacing, Accordion behavior: each section can expand/collapse (as shown in Figma).
Mobile: Popup is a full-height bottom sheet with drag-to-close + X button. Tablet/Desktop: Popup displayed as centered modal with rounded corners.
User can close the popup via: X icon in top-right corner, Swipe down (mobile), Click outside the modal (desktop).
